title: Business Plan Generator
description: Create comprehensive business plans for startups, funding, or strategic planning
author: Prompt Forge Pro

fields.label: Business Name
fields.placeholder: e.g., EcoTech Solutions

fields.label: Industry
fields.placeholder: e.g., SaaS Technology, Renewable Energy, Healthcare

fields.label: Primary Location
fields.placeholder: e.g., San Francisco, CA

fields.label: Problem Statement
fields.placeholder: e.g., Small businesses struggle with inventory management, leading to 30% waste
fields.helpText: What specific problem does your business solve?

fields.label: Solution Description
fields.placeholder: e.g., AI-powered inventory optimization platform that reduces waste by 75%

fields.label: Unique Value Proposition
fields.placeholder: e.g., Only solution that provides real-time predictive analytics with 99% accuracy

fields.label: Revenue Streams
fields.placeholder: e.g., Monthly subscriptions $99/month, Premium features $299/month, Training $5k

fields.label: Target Market
fields.placeholder: e.g., Small to medium restaurants (50-500 employees) in North America

fields.label: Market Size
fields.placeholder: e.g., $2.5B TAM, $500M SAM, $50M SOM
fields.helpText: Total Addressable Market, Serviceable Addressable Market, Serviceable Obtainable Market

fields.label: Target Customer Profile
fields.placeholder: e.g., Restaurant managers, 25-45 years old, tech-savvy, cost-conscious

fields.label: Competitive Landscape
fields.placeholder: e.g., Direct: Inventory Corp, Toast; Indirect: Excel, manual processes

fields.label: Market Trends
fields.placeholder: e.g., Increasing focus on sustainability, labor shortages, digital transformation

fields.label: Product/Service Description
fields.placeholder: e.g., Cloud-based platform with mobile app, AI analytics dashboard, integration APIs

fields.label: Key Features
fields.placeholder: e.g., Real-time tracking, predictive analytics, automated reordering, waste reporting

fields.label: Intellectual Property Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Patent pending on AI algorithm, trademark on brand name

fields.label: Pricing Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Competitive pricing 20% below market leader, freemium model

fields.label: Marketing Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Content marketing, trade shows, partner referrals, digital advertising

fields.label: Sales Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Inside sales team, channel partners, self-service online

fields.label: Customer Acquisition Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., SEO/SEM, referrals, industry partnerships, free trials

fields.label: Distribution Channels
fields.placeholder: e.g., Direct online sales, reseller network, app stores

fields.label: Partnership Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Integration partners, resellers, technology alliances

fields.label: Operational Model
fields.placeholder: e.g., Cloud-based infrastructure, remote team, outsourced customer support

fields.label: Supply Chain
fields.placeholder: e.g., SaaS model - no physical supply chain, API dependencies
fields.helpText: How you source, produce, and deliver

fields.label: Technology Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., AWS cloud infrastructure, React frontend, Python backend, ML models

fields.label: Quality Control
fields.placeholder: e.g., Automated testing, code reviews, customer feedback loops

fields.label: Scaling Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Horizontal scaling with microservices, geographic expansion plan

fields.label: Founder Background
fields.placeholder: e.g., 10 years restaurant industry experience, former software engineer at Google

fields.label: Key Team Members
fields.placeholder: e.g., CTO: AI/ML expert, VP Sales: 15 years B2B sales

fields.label: Advisors
fields.placeholder: e.g., Former restaurant chain CEO, AI industry veteran

fields.label: Hiring Plan
fields.placeholder: e.g., 5 engineers, 3 sales reps, 2 customer success by end of year

fields.label: Organizational Structure
fields.placeholder: e.g., Flat structure, functional teams, remote-first culture

fields.label: Funding Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., $2M Series A for growth and expansion

fields.label: Revenue Projections
fields.placeholder: e.g., Year 1: $100K, Year 2: $500K, Year 3: $2M

fields.label: Expense Breakdown
fields.placeholder: e.g., 60% personnel, 20% technology, 15% marketing, 5% other

fields.label: Profitability Timeline
fields.placeholder: e.g., Break-even by month 18, profitable by month 24

fields.label: Key Financial Assumptions
fields.placeholder: e.g., 5% monthly churn, $150 CAC, 3x LTV/CAC ratio

fields.label: Key Business Risks
fields.placeholder: e.g., Market adoption, competition, technology changes, regulatory

fields.label: Risk Mitigation Strategies
fields.placeholder: e.g., Diversified customer base, patent protection, regulatory compliance

fields.label: Contingency Plans
fields.placeholder: e.g., Pivot to different market segment, licensing model, acquisition strategy
fields.helpText: Backup plans if primary strategy doesn't work

fields.label: Key Milestones
fields.placeholder: e.g., MVP launch Q1, first 100 customers Q2, Series A Q3

fields.label: Implementation Timeline
fields.placeholder: e.g., 18-month roadmap with quarterly goals

fields.label: Success Metrics
fields.placeholder: e.g., ARR growth, customer acquisition cost, net promoter score

fields.label: Funding Purpose
fields.placeholder: e.g., Series A to accelerate growth and market expansion

fields.label: Use of Funds
fields.placeholder: e.g., 50% engineering, 30% sales & marketing, 20% operations

fields.label: Investor Benefits
fields.placeholder: e.g., High growth potential, experienced team, defensible moat

fields.label: Exit Strategy
fields.placeholder: e.g., Strategic acquisition by industry leader, IPO in 7-10 years

title: Market Research Analyst
description: Conduct comprehensive market research and competitive analysis
author: Prompt Forge Pro

fields.label: Industry/Market
fields.placeholder: e.g., Cloud Computing SaaS, Electric Vehicle Charging, Telehealth

fields.label: Target Geography
fields.placeholder: e.g., North America, EMEA, Global, Specific cities

fields.label: Market Definition
fields.placeholder: e.g., Software solutions for SMB accounting and bookkeeping
fields.helpText: How do you define the market you're researching?

fields.label: Market Segments
fields.placeholder: e.g., Enterprise (1000+ employees), SMB (50-1000), Startups (<50)

fields.label: Market Growth Drivers
fields.placeholder: e.g., Digital transformation, regulatory compliance, cost reduction
fields.helpText: What factors are driving market growth?

fields.label: Market Barriers
fields.placeholder: e.g., High switching costs, regulatory requirements, technical complexity
fields.helpText: What barriers exist to market entry or growth?

fields.label: Data Sources
fields.placeholder: e.g., Gartner reports, company filings, industry surveys, expert interviews
fields.helpText: What data sources should be used?

fields.label: Total Addressable Market (TAM)
fields.placeholder: e.g., All businesses that could potentially use the solution globally

fields.label: Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM)
fields.placeholder: e.g., Businesses in target geographies with sufficient budget

fields.label: Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM)
fields.placeholder: e.g., Realistic market share achievable in 3-5 years

fields.label: Primary Target Segments
fields.placeholder: e.g., Mid-market technology companies, fast-growing startups

fields.label: Customer Demographics
fields.placeholder: e.g., Company size, revenue, industry, decision makers' profiles

fields.label: Customer Behavior Patterns
fields.placeholder: e.g., How they research solutions, buying frequency, budget cycles

fields.label: Customer Buying Process
fields.placeholder: e.g., Problem identification → Research → Vendor evaluation → Purchase

fields.label: Key Customer Pain Points
fields.placeholder: e.g., Manual processes, lack of integration, high costs, poor support

fields.label: Decision Criteria
fields.placeholder: e.g., Price, features, integration capabilities, vendor reputation

fields.label: Direct Competitors
fields.placeholder: e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive

fields.label: Indirect Competitors
fields.placeholder: e.g., Excel spreadsheets, custom-built solutions, manual processes

fields.label: Competitive Positioning
fields.placeholder: e.g., Premium features vs. budget-friendly vs. ease-of-use

fields.label: Competitive Pricing Analysis
fields.placeholder: e.g., Enterprise: $100-500/user/month, SMB: $20-100/user/month

fields.label: Competitive SWOT Focus
fields.placeholder: e.g., Analyze top 3 competitors' strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, threats
fields.helpText: What should the SWOT analysis focus on?

fields.label: Emerging Market Trends
fields.placeholder: e.g., AI integration, mobile-first design, API-first architecture

fields.label: Technology Trends
fields.placeholder: e.g., Artificial intelligence, blockchain, IoT integration

fields.label: Regulatory Changes
fields.placeholder: e.g., GDPR compliance, data sovereignty laws, industry regulations

fields.label: Social/Cultural Shifts
fields.placeholder: e.g., Remote work adoption, digital-first mindset, sustainability focus

fields.label: Economic Factors
fields.placeholder: e.g., Economic uncertainty, inflation, funding availability

fields.label: Identified Market Gaps
fields.placeholder: e.g., No solution for mid-market with specific compliance needs

fields.label: Growth Opportunities
fields.placeholder: e.g., International expansion, new verticals, adjacent products

fields.label: Threat Assessment
fields.placeholder: e.g., New entrants, substitute products, changing customer needs

fields.label: Market Entry Barriers
fields.placeholder: e.g., High customer acquisition costs, technical complexity, regulatory approval
fields.helpText: Barriers for new companies entering the market

fields.label: Key Success Factors
fields.placeholder: e.g., Strong technology, customer relationships, channel partnerships
fields.helpText: What factors lead to success in this market?

fields.label: Primary Research Methods
fields.placeholder: e.g., Customer surveys, expert interviews, focus groups

fields.label: Secondary Research Sources
fields.placeholder: e.g., Industry reports, company websites, news articles, academic papers

fields.label: Data Collection Methods
fields.placeholder: e.g., Online surveys, phone interviews, web scraping, API data

fields.label: Target Sample Size
fields.placeholder: e.g., 200 customer surveys, 20 expert interviews

fields.label: Data Validation Methods
fields.placeholder: e.g., Triangulation, expert validation, cross-referencing sources
fields.helpText: How will research findings be validated?

fields.label: Specific Research Questions
fields.placeholder: e.g., What's the average implementation time? How important is mobile access?

fields.label: Stakeholder Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., Sales team needs competitor feature comparison, Marketing needs buyer personas

title: Legal Document Drafter
description: Draft professional legal documents and contracts with proper structure and clauses
author: Prompt Forge Pro

fields.label: Jurisdiction
fields.placeholder: e.g., California, USA; Ontario, Canada; England and Wales
fields.helpText: Where will this agreement be enforced?

fields.label: Governing Law
fields.placeholder: e.g., Laws of the State of California

fields.label: Document Purpose
fields.placeholder: e.g., Engage consultant for software development services
fields.helpText: Brief description of what this agreement accomplishes

fields.label: First Party Details
fields.placeholder: e.g., TechCorp Inc., Delaware corporation, 123 Main St, San Francisco, CA
fields.helpText: Full legal name, entity type, and address

fields.label: Second Party Details
fields.placeholder: e.g., John Smith Consulting LLC, California LLC, 456 Oak Ave, Los Angeles, CA
fields.helpText: Full legal name, entity type, and address

fields.label: Signatory Authority
fields.placeholder: e.g., CEO has authority to bind corporation, individual acting on own behalf
fields.helpText: Who has authority to sign for each party?

fields.label: Scope of Work/Agreement
fields.placeholder: e.g., Development of mobile application with specified features and functionality
fields.helpText: Detailed description of what's being agreed to

fields.label: Key Obligations
fields.placeholder: e.g., Client provides requirements and feedback; Consultant delivers code and documentation

fields.label: Payment Terms
fields.placeholder: e.g., $150/hour, invoiced monthly, Net 30 payment terms

fields.label: Deliverables/Performance Standards
fields.placeholder: e.g., Working mobile app, source code, documentation, 99% uptime SLA

fields.label: Timeline/Duration
fields.placeholder: e.g., 6-month project term, renewable annually, ends December 31, 2024

fields.label: Intellectual Property Rights
fields.placeholder: e.g., Client owns all work product, Consultant retains pre-existing IP

fields.label: Termination Conditions
fields.placeholder: e.g., Either party with 30 days notice, for cause immediately

fields.label: Insurance Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., $1M professional liability, general liability coverage

fields.label: Compliance Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., GDPR compliance, SOC 2 certification, industry regulations

fields.label: Special Provisions
fields.placeholder: e.g., Non-compete clause, exclusivity requirements, milestone bonuses
fields.helpText: Any unique clauses needed for this agreement

fields.label: Custom Terms
fields.placeholder: e.g., Right of first refusal, automatic renewal, performance penalties
fields.helpText: Specific terms unique to this relationship

fields.label: Industry-Specific Requirements
fields.placeholder: e.g., HIPAA compliance for healthcare, PCI compliance for payments

fields.label: Regulatory Compliance
fields.placeholder: e.g., Export control laws, data privacy regulations, financial regulations

fields.label: Template Style Preferences
fields.placeholder: e.g., Plain English preferred, formal legal language, business-friendly terms
fields.helpText: Preferred style and approach for the document

fields.label: Risk Tolerance
fields.helpText: How risk-averse should the document be?
